item.title: 曾经热衷于向前景看好的印度科技企业注入数十亿美元资金的投资者们，现在却开始放慢脚步，开出更少的支票。曾经在市场上声名显赫的新公司，其估值和风头都一落千丈，令他们焦头烂额。
item.description:
Investors, once eager to pump in billions of dollars in promising Indian tech ventures, are now going slow and cutting smaller cheques. They've been burnt by ignominious falls from grace - and valuations - for once-marquee market debutants https://t.co/AGN33Hj37V

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 意大利对人工智能经验和专业知识的需求激增，监管机构发现自己也在争夺这个浅水池中的人才。但相对较低的薪酬、漫长的招聘流程和签证问题阻碍了他们的招聘雄心
item.description:
Demand for AI experience and expertise has surged in Italy, and regulators have found themselves vying for talent from the same shallow pool. But relatively low pay, long hiring processes and visa problems are thwarting their hiring ambitions https://t.co/IdFMeqC5p7

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 日本央行行长上田一夫表示，央行最终将缩减债券购买规模，并允许市场力量决定长期利率走势，这表明他决心稳步推进超宽松货币政策正常化。
item.description:
Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said the central bank will eventually scale back bond purchases and allow market forces to set long-term interest rate moves, signaling his resolve to move steadily towards normalising ultra-loose monetary policy https://t.co/lSdPWR8KWU

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 数百万日本人，从小业主到首次购房者，都在掂量着如何在漫长的通货紧缩岁月之后适应更高的借贷成本。
item.description:
Millions of Japanese, from small business owners to first-time homebuyers, are sizing up how to adapt to higher borrowing costs after the long, lean years of deflation, when prices, wages and the cost of money changed little https://t.co/mRi19lyLE8

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 观看：华尔街三大股指周四连续第二天创下收盘纪录新高，道指收盘时距离40,000点水平首次不到1%的距离
item.description:
WATCH: Wall Street's three major stock indexes on Thursday registered record closing highs for the second day in a row and the Dow ended the day less than 1% away from the 40,000 level for the first time https://t.co/piUm72cx5n pic.twitter.com/veqlBV5iDj

item.title: 社交媒体平台 Reddit 的股票在纽约首日交易结束时上涨了 48%，表明投资者对有前途但亏损的公司首次公开募股的热情可能正在恢复：
item.description:
Social media platform Reddit's shares ended their first day of trading in New York up 48%, signaling that investor appetite for initial public offerings of promising yet loss-making companies could be returning.
More here: https://t.co/UCjilF97wE pic.twitter.com/6WccmnKWbj

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 美国司法部长梅里克-加兰宣布对苹果公司提起具有里程碑意义的诉讼，指控这家 iPhone 制造商垄断智能手机市场，违反了联邦反垄断法。苹果公司在一份声明中否认了政府的指控
item.description:
US Attorney General Merrick Garland announced a landmark lawsuit against Apple, accusing the iPhone maker of violating federal antitrust law by monopolizing the smartphone market. Apple denied the government's allegations in a statement https://t.co/9TTQfqiaDf pic.twitter.com/XwsAKGSNew

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 观看：美联储就降息时机向投资者作出保证后，华尔街主要股指周四创下收盘新高；美光科技（Micron Technology）作出乐观预测后，芯片股大涨
item.description:
WATCH: Wall Street's main indexes on Thursday hit new closing highs after the Federal Reserve reassured investors about the timing of rate cuts, while chip stocks rallied after Micron Technology's upbeat forecast https://t.co/piUm72bZfP pic.twitter.com/vZNyu8H2LZ

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 来自 @Breakingviews：这家媒体巨头正在与激进分子纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）就即将举行的董事会选举进行争斗。星球大战》的创作者乔治-卢卡斯（George Lucas）等大腕站在迪士尼一边，但经营良好的公司都会接纳不同意见。佩尔茨应该进入董事会，@jennifersaba 解释道
item.description:
From @Breakingviews: The media giant is fighting with activist Nelson Peltz over its looming board elections. Big names like Star Wars creator George Lucas are on Disney’s side, but well-run companies embrace dissent. Peltz should be on the board, explains @jennifersaba pic.twitter.com/PQkku41Lke

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024
